name: c01n_sh1ft
description:
Jump in the role of a hacker breaking into complex systems to steal as many bitcoins as possible. All levels are procedurally generated and can be fully solved by shifting the right rows and columns in the right order. Can you collect all coins or will you take the easy path?

Explanation:

On every level, you have a certain amount of blocks displayed in the right panel. Blocks are always used in order from left to right and top to bottom. When clicking on an arrow next to a row or column, the block shift the whole row/column and the last block will be destroyed. 

As soon as your program (shown in blue) has a valid path to the network node (displayed in green), you will be able to execute the run command by clicking on the corresponding button in the right bottom corner. The path of the program is highlighted in green.
